headline: Texas Instruments, Analog Devices Stocks Fall. China Inquiry Targets U.S. Chip Makers.
summary: Shares of  Texas Instruments  and  Analog Devices  were among the worst performers in the  index in premarket trading Monday after China launched two investigations targeting U.S. chip makers.  The Chinese Ministry of Commerce announced over the weekend that it initiated an anti-dumping investigation on imports of relevant analog integrated circuit (IC) chips originating in the U.S., according to a translation of an official statement published online.  Makers of analog and embedded semiconductors often used in the auto and industrial industries, as opposed to the artificial-intelligence chips produced by  Nvidia  fell in premarket trading Monday.
